info.title: Azure Machine Learning Datastore Management Client

get.description: Get the list of Datastores attached to the workspace.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The Name of the resource group in which the workspace is located.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Count of Datastores to be returned.

parameters.name: includeSecret
parameters.description: Whether to include the datastore secret in the response.

200.description: The list of Datastores are returned successfully.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Create or update a Datastore in the given workspace.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The Name of the resource group in which the workspace is located.

parameters.name: createIfNotExists
parameters.description: If set to true, the call will create an Datastore if it doesn't exist.

parameters.name: skipValidation
parameters.description: If set to true, the call will skip Datastore validation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Delete all Datastores in the workspace.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The Name of the resource group in which the workspace is located.

200.description: All the Datastores in the workspace are deleted successfully.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get details of a Datastore with a specific name.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The Name of the resource group in which the workspace is located.

200.description: The Datastore details are returned successfully.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Update or create a Datastore in the given workspace.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The Name of the resource group in which the workspace is located.

parameters.name: createIfNotExists
parameters.description: If set to true, the call will create an Datastore if it doesn't exist.

parameters.name: skipValidation
parameters.description: If set to true, the call will skip Datastore validation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Delete a Datastore with a specific name.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The Name of the resource group in which the workspace is located.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get the default Datastore in the workspace.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The Name of the resource group in which the workspace is located.

200.description: The default Datastore is returned successfully.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Set a default Datastore in the workspace.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The Name of the resource group in which the workspace is located.

200.description: The default Datastore is set successfully.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

authorityUrl.description: The authority URL used for authentication

certificate.description: The content of the certificate used for authentication

isCertAuth.description: Is it using certificate to authenticate. If false then use client secret

resourceUri.description: The resource the service principal/app has access to

storeName.description: The Azure Data Lake store name

tenantId.description: The ID of the tenant the service principal/app belongs to

thumbprint.description: The thumbprint of the certificate above

endpoint.description: The Azure PostgreSQL server host endpoint

authorityUrl.description: The authority URL used for authentication

certificate.description: The content of the certificate used for authentication

isCertAuth.description: Is it using certificate to authenticate. If false then use client secret

resourceUri.description: The resource the service principal/app has access to

tenantId.description: The ID of the tenant the service principal/app belongs to

thumbprint.description: The thumbprint of the certificate above

areWorkspaceManagedIdentitiesAllowed.description: Indicate if we are using Workspace ManagedIdentities/MSI token

blobCacheTimeout.description: If this is an Microsoft.MachineLearning.DataStore.Contracts.DataStoreType.AzureBlob, the length of time (in seconds) to cache files locally after they are accessed (downloaded).

isSas.description: Indicate if we are using SAS token or Account Key (Deprecated)

protocol.description: The protocol to use. Defaults to https

authorityUrl.description: The authority URL used for authentication

certificate.description: The content of the certificate used for authentication

isCertAuth.description: Is it using certificate to authenticate. If false then use client secret

resourceUri.description: The resource the service principal/app has access to

tenantId.description: The ID of the tenant the service principal/app belongs to

thumbprint.description: The thumbprint of the certificate above

dataStoreType.description: The Azure storage service this datastore points to.

hasBeenValidated.description: A read only property that denotes whether the service datastore has been validated with credentials.

target.description: The target of the error (e.g., the name of the property in error).

correlation.description: Dictionary containing correlation details for the error.

serverAddress.description:
The server address of one of the servers that hosts the GlusterFS. Can be either the IP address
or server name.

volumeName.description: The name of the created GlusterFS volume.

continuationToken.description: The token used in retrieving the next page.  If null, there are no additional pages.

nextLink.description: The link to the next page constructed using the continuationToken.  If null, there are no additional pages.

value.description: An array of objects of type DataStore.

code.description: The service-defined error code. Supported error codes: ServiceError, UserError, ValidationError, AzureStorageError, TransientError, RequestThrottled.

details.description: The related errors that occurred during the request.

message.description: A human-readable representation of the error.

target.description: The target of the error (e.g., the name of the property in error).

resourceGroupNameParameter.name: resourceGroupName
resourceGroupNameParameter.description: The Name of the resource group in which the workspace is located.
